source_document:
MDM: March 2024

Outcome

Patient under [redacted name] and has recently be admitted to improve with metastatic rectal tumour staging T3N0M0. Your thickening on the CT scan extends to the lower rectum with only 3.3 cm to the anorectal junction. As this extends quite low not suitable for a colonic stent and would suggest a defunctioning loop stoma.

Notes were taken by:
[redacted name]

cancer_timeline.value: thickening on the CT scan extends to the lower rectum with only 3.3 cm to the anorectal junction

clinical_summary.summary: Patient has metastatic rectal cancer (T3N0M0) with tumor extending to the lower rectum, making it unsuitable for colonic stent placement.

future_plan.value: would suggest a defunctioning loop stoma
